comments:
Test case:

jContentPane = new JPanel();
jContentPane.setLayout(new BoxLayout(jContentPane, BoxLayout.X_AXIS));			
jContentPane.add(Box.createRigidArea(new Dimension(50,175)));			

What occurs is that the following exception occurs on the target VM:
 
java.awt.AWTError: BoxLayout can't be shared
	at javax.swing.BoxLayout.checkContainer(BoxLayout.java:410)
	at javax.swing.BoxLayout.maximumLayoutSize(BoxLayout.java:295)
	at java.awt.Container.getMaximumSize(Container.java:1235)
	at javax.swing.JComponent.getMaximumSize(JComponent.java:1320)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.initParser.tree.ExpressionProcesser.pushMethodInvocation(ExpressionProcesser.java:2567)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.vm.remote.ExpressionProcesserController.process(ExpressionProcesserController.java:285)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.vm.remote.ConnectionHandler.processExpressionCommand(ConnectionHandler.java:598)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.vm.remote.ConnectionHandler.run(ConnectionHandler.java:493)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.vm.remote.ConnectionThread.run(ConnectionThread.java:47)

What has occured is that there is BoxLayout code that checks whether or not the
container of the BoxLayout is the same as the container it is being used for so
instances cannot be shared.  However the "target" field is null so it throws an
exception.  The same code runs if you do run as>Java Bean so it is something to
do with how we instantiate it on the target VM.

Rich, this is the same error we got in bug 99259. This was backported from your
batch mechanism changes and worked fine. Did we regress? Or is this a different
problem?

Nope, this hasn't changed since you put the fix in. So we need to know what
drivers the customer is running. It could be they have a pre-fix problem.

The original problem is fixed, but we have a new problem.

The new problem is Box.createRigidArea(...) is a factory method. We don't
support those at this time.
